oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Abstract of provisions sold to officers
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- Army -- Subsistence Dept.; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Food supply; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed and handwritten abstract of provisions form, submitted by Lieutenant William Alonzo Wainwright, Regimental Quartermaster of the 75th Indiana Infantry and Assistant Commissary of Subsistence, for subsistence stores sold to officers in the field. Indicated with each type of article are the quantity sold and the amount charged.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Subsistence Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Army regulations provided that an officer might draw subsistence stores by paying in cash, receiving them at contract or cost prices, not including the cost of transportation. Officers generally ate better than the average soldier.
